training_philosophy: Polarized training with 80% easy, 20% hard intensity distribution
evidence_base: Olympic marathon training and physiological research

exercises.scientific_explanation: Tempo runs are performed at lactate threshold pace (15k-half marathon race pace) to improve the body's ability to clear lactate and maintain speed. Research shows 8-12% improvements in marathon performance when tempo runs comprise 8-10% of weekly volume. Daniels' research with Olympic athletes demonstrates optimal duration of 20-40 minutes at threshold pace.
exercises.performance_metrics: Lactate threshold pace, heart rate zones 3-4, perceived effort 6-7/10
exercises.form_cue: Maintain steady, controlled effort that feels comfortably hard
exercises.common_mistake: Starting too fast and fading, or running at marathon pace instead of threshold

exercises.scientific_explanation: VO2max intervals at 3k-5k race pace develop maximal oxygen uptake and running economy. Research demonstrates 15-20% improvements in VO2max when performed 1-2x weekly. Daniels' protocol of 5x1000m with equal rest optimizes stimulus while preventing overreaching.
exercises.performance_metrics: 3k-5k race pace, VO2max 90-95%, heart rate 95-100% max
exercises.form_cue: Maintain relaxed shoulders and efficient stride at hard but sustainable effort
exercises.common_mistake: Running too fast early in workout or inadequate recovery between intervals

exercises.scientific_explanation: Long runs develop aerobic capacity, fat oxidation, and mental toughness essential for marathon performance. Research shows optimal duration of 90-180 minutes at conversational pace to maximize mitochondrial adaptations and capillary density improvements.
exercises.performance_metrics: Conversational pace, 65-75% max heart rate, perceived effort 3-5/10
exercises.form_cue: Maintain relaxed, sustainable pace where you can hold conversation
exercises.common_mistake: Running too fast and turning aerobic run into moderate intensity

exercises.scientific_explanation: Hill repeats develop running-specific power and strength while improving running economy and stride efficiency. Research shows 6-8% improvements in running economy and enhanced neuromuscular power when incorporated 1x weekly into training.
research_citations: Ferley et al. (2020): Hill training effects on running economy
exercises.form_cue: Drive with arms, maintain upright posture, powerful push-off
exercises.common_mistake: Leaning too far forward or not driving with arms

exercises.scientific_explanation: A-skips develop running-specific coordination, hip flexor strength, and proper foot strike mechanics. Research demonstrates improvements in stride frequency and running economy when performed as part of dynamic warm-up protocol.
research_citations: Saunders et al. (2006): Running technique interventions
exercises.performance_metrics: Focus on technique over speed, 20-30m distances
exercises.form_cue: Drive knee up, quick ground contact, maintain upright posture

exercises.scientific_explanation: Single-leg calf raises address the unilateral demands of running while building calf strength and endurance. Research shows 25% reduction in calf and achilles injuries when performed 3x weekly as part of runner strength training.
research_citations: Nielsen et al. (2014): Running injury prevention
exercises.performance_metrics: 15-25 reps per leg, slow controlled movement
exercises.form_cue: Rise up high on one foot, lower slowly and controlled
exercises.common_mistake: Not achieving full range of motion or using momentum
